title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: Birth of Abdullah, the Holy Prophet's father.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: Birth of the Holy Prophet. Year of the Elephant. Invasion of Makkah by Abraha the Viceroy of Yemen, his retreat.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet visits Madina with his mother. Death of his mother.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: Death of Abdul Muttalib, the grandfather of the Holy Prophet.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet's journey to Syria in the company of his uncle Abu Talib. His meeting with the monk Bahira at Bisra who foretells of his prophethood.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet participates in the war of Fijar.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet becomes an active member of "Hilful Fudul", a league for the relief of the distressed.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet becomes the Manager of the business of Lady Khadija, and leads her trade caravan to Syria and back.

title: 6th Century (500-599) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet marries Hadrat Khadija. Seventh century

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet arbitrates in a dispute among the Quraish about the placing of the Black Stone in the Kaaba.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: The first revelation in the cave at Mt. Hira. The Holy Prophet is commissioned as the Messenger of God.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Declaration at Mt. Sara inviting the general public to Islam.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Invitation to the Hashimites to accept Islam.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Persecution of the Muslims by the Quraish. A party of Muslims leaves for Abyssinia.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Second Hijrah to Abysinnia.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Social boycott of the Hashimites and the Holy Prophet by the Quraish. The Hashimites are shut up in a glen outside Makkah.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Lifting of the boycott. Deaths of Abu Talib and Hadrat Khadija. Year of sorrow.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Journey to Taif. Ascension to the heavens.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: First pledge at Aqaba.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Second pledge at Aqaba. The Holy Prophet and the Muslims migrate to Yathrib. 623:\tNakhla expedition.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Badr. Expulsion of the Bani Qainuqa Jews from Madina.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Uhud. Massacre of 70 Muslims at Bir Mauna. Expulsion of Banu Nadir Jews from Madina. Second expedition of Badr.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Expedition of Banu Mustaliq.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of the Trench. Expulsion of Banu Quraiza Jews.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Truce of Hudaibiya. Expedition to Khyber. The Holy Prophet addresses letters to various heads of states.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: The Holy Prophet performs the pilgrimage at Makkah. Expedition to Muta (Romans).

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Makkah. Battles of Hunsin, Auras, and Taif.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Expedition to Tabuk. Year of Deputations.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Farewell pilgrimage at Makkah.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Death of the Holy Prophet. Election of Hadrat Abu Bakr as the Caliph. Usamah leads expedition to Syria. Battles of Zu Qissa and Abraq. Battles of Buzakha, Zafar and Naqra. Campaigns against Bani Tamim and Musailima, the Liar.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Campaigns in Bahrain, Oman, Mahrah Yemen, and Hadramaut. Raids in Iraq. Battles of Kazima, Mazar, Walaja, Ulleis, Hirah, Anbar, Ein at tamr, Daumatul Jandal and Firaz.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battles of Basra, Damascus and Ajnadin. Death of Hadrat Abu Bakr. Hadrat Umar Farooq becomes the Caliph. Battles of Namaraq and Saqatia.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Bridge. Battle of Buwaib. Conquest of Damascus. Battle of Fahl.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Yermuk. Battle of Qadsiyia. Conquest of Madain.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Syria. Fall of Jerusalem. Battle of Jalula.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Jazirah.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Khuizistan. Advance into Egypt.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Capture of the post of Caesaria in Syria. Conquest of Shustar and Jande Sabur in Persia. Battle of Babylon in Egypt.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Nihawand. Conquest Of Alexandria in Egypt.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Rayy in Persia. Conquest of Egypt. Foundation of Fustat.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Azarbaijan and Tabaristan (Russia).

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Fars, Kerman, Sistan, Mekran and Kharan.Martyrdom of Hadrat Umar. Hadrat Othman becomes the Caliph.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Campaigns in Fats.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Campaigns in Khurasan, Armeain and Asia Minor.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Campaigns in North Africa. Conquest of the island of Cypress.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Campaigns against the Byzantines.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Naval battle of the Masts against the Byzantines.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Discontentment and disaffection against the rule of Hadrat Othman.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Martyrdom of Hadrat Othman. Hadrat Ali becomes the Caliph. Battle of the Camel.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Hadrat Ali shifts the capital from Madina to Kufa. Battle of Siffin. Arbitration proceedings at Daumaut ul Jandal.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Nahrawan.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Conquest of Egypt by Mu'awiyah.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Hadrat Ali recaptures Hijaz and Yemen from Mu'awiyah. Mu'awiyah declares himself as the Caliph at Damascus.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Martyrdom of Hadrat Ali. Accession of Hadrat Hasan and his abdication. Mu'awiyah becomes the sole Caliph.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Khawarij revolts.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Raid of Sicily.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Advance in North Africa. Uqba b Nafe founds the town of Qairowan in Tunisia. Conquest of Kabul.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Capture of the island of Rhodes. Campaigns in Khurasan.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: The Muslims cross the Oxus. Bukhara becomes a vassal state.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Occupation of Sarnarkand and Tirmiz. Siege of Constantinople.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Death of Muawiyah. Accession of Yazid. Tragedy of Kerbala and martyrdom of Hadrat Hussain.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: In North Africa Uqba b Nafe marches to the Atlantic, is ambushed and killed at Biskra. The Muslims evacuate Qairowan and withdraw to Burqa.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Death of Yazid. Accession of Mu'awiyah II.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Abdullah b Zubair declares himself aS the Caliph at'Makkah. Marwan I becomes the Caliph' at Damascus. Battle of Marj Rahat.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Death of Marwan I. Abdul Malik becomes the Caliph at Damascus. Battle of Ain ul Wada.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Mukhtar declares himself as the Caliph at Kufa.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Kufa between the forces of Mukhtar and Abdullah b Zubair. Mukhtar killed.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Battle of Deir ul Jaliq. Kufa falls to Abdul Malik.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: The fall of Makkah. Death of Abdullah b Zubair. Abdul Malik becomes the sole Caliph.

title: 7th Century (600-699) C.E.
text: Khawarij revolts in Jazira and Ahwaz. Battle of the Karun. Campaigns against Kahina in North Africa. The' Muslims once again withdraw to Barqa. The Muslims advance in Transoxiana and occupy Kish.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Campaigns against the Berbers in North Africa.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Ashath's rebellion in Iraq, battle of Deir ul Jamira.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Abdul Malik. Accession of Walid I as Caliph.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Conquest of Spain, Sind and Transoxiana.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: The Muslims advance in Spain, Sind and Transoxiana.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Conquest of Multan.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Walid I. Accession of Sulaiman.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Invasion of Constantinople.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Sulaiman. Accession of Umar b Abdul Aziz.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Umar b Abdul Aziz. Accession of Yazid II.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Yazid II. Accession of Hisham.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: The Muslims occupy Nimes in France.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: The battle of Tours in France.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: The Muslims meet reverse at Avignon in France.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Shia revolt under Zaid b Ali. Berber revolt in North Africa. Battle of the Nobles.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battle of Bagdoura in North Africa.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: The Muslim rule restored in Qiarowan.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Hisham. Accession of Walid II. Shia revolt in Khurasan under Yahya b Zaid.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Deposition of Walid I1. Accession of Yazid II1 and his death. Accession of Ibrahim and his overthrow. Battle of Ain al Jurr. Accession of Marwan II.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Kufa and Mosul occupied by the Khawarjites.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battle of Rupar Thutha, Kufa and Mosul occupied by Marwan II.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Revolt of Abu Muslim in Khurasan.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battle of Rayy.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battles of lsfahan and Nihawand. Capture of Kufa by the Abbasids. As Saffah becomes the Abbasid Caliph at Kufa.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battle of Zab. Fall of Damascus. End of the Umayyads.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Conquest of Wasit by the Abbasid. Murder of the Minister Abu Salama.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of As Saffah. Accession of Mansur as the Caliph.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Revolt of Abdullah b Ali. MUrder of Abu Muslim. Sunbadh revolt in Khurasan.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Abdul Rahman founds the Umayyad state in Spain.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Shia revolt under Muhammad (Nafs uz Zakia) and Ibrahim.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Foundation of Baghdad. Defeat of the Abbasids in Spain.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Khariji state set up by Ibn Madrar at Sijilmasa. Ustad Sees revolt in Khurasan.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battle of Janbi in North Africa. Rustamid. state set up in Morocco.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death or the Abbasid Caliph Mansur, Accession of Mahdi,

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Battle of Saragossa in Spain.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of the Caliph Mahdi. Accession of Hadi.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Hadi. Accession of Harun ur Rashid.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Idrisid state set up in the Maghrib. Death of Abdul Rahman of Spain, and accession of Hisham.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Invasion of South France.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Death of Hisham in Spain; accession of al Hakam.

title: 8th Century (700-799) C.E.
text: Suppression of the revolt of the Khazars. Ninth century.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: The Aghlabid rule is established in North Africa.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Downfall of the Barmakids. Execution of Jafar Barmki.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Campaigns against the Byzantines. Capture of the islands of Rhodes and Cypress.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Harun ur Rashid. Accession of Amin.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Civil war between Amin and Mamun. Amin killed and Mamun becomes the Caliph.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Shia revolt under Ibn Tuba Tabs.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Shia revolt in Makkah; Harsama quells the revolt. In Spain the Umayyads capture the island of Corsica.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Harsama killed.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: The Umayyads of Spain capture the islands of Izira, Majorica, and Sardinia.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Mamun comes to Baghdad.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Tahir establishes the rule of the Tahirids in Khurasan.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of AI Hakam in Spain; accession of Abdul Rahman. II.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Tahir in Khurasan. Accession of Talha and his deposition. Accession of Abdullah b Tahir.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Mamun declares the Mutazila creed as the state religion.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Mamun. Accession of Mutasim.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Mutasim shifts the capital to Samarra. 837 Revolt of the Jats.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Revolt of Babek in Azarbaijan suppressed.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Revolt of Maziar in Tabaristan. The Muslims occupy South Italy. Capture of the city of Messina in Sicily.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Mutasim, accession of Wasiq.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Revolts of the Arabs.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Wasiq, accession of Mutawakkil.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of the Tahirid ruler Abdullah b Tahir; accession of Tahir II.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Mutawakkil restores orthodoxy.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Abdur Rahman II of Spain;. accession of Muhammad I.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Umar b Abdul Aziz founds the Habbarid rule in Sind.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Mutawakkil founds the town of Jafariya.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Ahmad founds the Samanid rule in Transoxiana.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Murder of the Abbasid Caliph Mutawakkil; accession of Muntasir.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Muntasir poisoned to death; accession of Mutasin.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Zaidi state established in Tabaristan by Hasan b Zaid.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Mutasim flies from Samarra, his depostion and accession of Mutaaz.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Muhammad I the Umayyad ruler of Spain, accession of Munzir. Death of Abdullah b Umar the Habbari ruler of Sind.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Yaqub b Layth founds the Saffarid rule in Sistan.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Ahmad b Tulun founds the Tulunid rule in Egypt.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: The Abbasid Caliph Mutaaz forced to abdicate, his death and accession of Muhtadi.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Turks revolt against Muhtadi, his death and accession of Mutamid.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Tahirid rule extinguished.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Zanj revolt in South Iraq. Death of the Samanid ruler Ahmad, accession of Nasr.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Yaqubb Layth in Sistan, accession of Amr b Layth.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Ahmad b Tulun in Egypt, accession of Khamar- wiyiah.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of Munzir the Umayyad ruler of Spain, accession of Abbullah.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: The Qarmatian state established at Bahrain.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of the Samanid ruler Nasr, accession of Ismail.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: The Rustamids become the vassals of Spain.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Death of the Tulunid ruler Khamarwiyiah; accession of Abul Asakir Jaish.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Assassination of Abul Asakir Jaish; accession of Abu Musa Harun.

title: 9th Century (800-899) C.E.
text: Qarmatians sack Basra,

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Abbasid Caliph Muktafi; death of the Saffarid ruler Amr.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Assassination of the Qarmatian ruler Abu Said; accession of Abu Tahir.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Abdullah b Hamdan founds the Hamdanid rule in Mosul and Jazira. End of the Tulunid rule in Egypt.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Abbasid Caliph Muktafi; accession of Muqtadir,

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: End of the Saffarid rule, annexation of their territories by the Samanids.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Ubaidullah overthrows the Aghlablds and founds the Fatimid rule in North Africa.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Umayyad Amir Abdullah in Spain, accession of Abdur Rahman III.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Assassination of the Samanid ruler Ahmad II, accession of Nasr II.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Mardawij b Ziyar founds the Ziyarid rule in Tabaristan.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Qarmatians sack Makkah and carry away the Black Stone from the Holy Kaaba. In Spain, Abdur Rahman III declares himself as the Caliph.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Deposition and restoration of the Abbasid Caliph Muqtadir. Death of the Qarmatian ruler Abu Tahir; accession of Abu Mansur.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Abbasid Caliph Muqtadir; accession of Al Qahir.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Deposition of the Abbasid Caliph AI Qahir; accession of Ar Radi. Death of the Fatimid Caliph Ubaidullah ; accession of Al Qaim.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Assassination of the Ziyarid ruler Mardawij; accession of Washimgir. Death of Hamdanid ruler Abdullah b Hamdan accession of Nasir ud Daula.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: By coup Ibn Raiq becomes the Amir ul Umara.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: By another coup power at Baghdad is captured by Bajkam.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Abbasid Caliph Ar Radi, accession of Muttaqi.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Assassination of Bajkam, capture of power by Kurtakin.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Ibn Raiq recaptures power.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Al Baeidi captures power. The Abbasid Caliph Muttaqi is forced to seek refuge with the Hamdanids. Sail ud Daula captures power at Baghdad and the Caliph returns to' Baghdad. Power is captured by Tuzun and Sail ud Daula retires' to Mosul. Death of the Samanid ruler Nasr II, accession of Nuh.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Muttaqi is blinded and deposed, accession of Mustakafi.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of Tuzun. Shirzad becomes Amir ul Umra. The Buwayhids capture power. Deposition of the Abbasid Caliph Mustakafi.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Fatimid Caliph A1 Qaim. accession of Mansur. Death of the Ikhshid ruler Muhammad b Tughj, accession of Abul' Qasim Ungur. 951:\tThe Qarnaatiana restore the Black Stone to the Holy Kaaba.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Sasanid ruler Nuh, accession of Abdul Malik.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Samanid ruler Abdul Malik, accession of Manauf. Alptgin founds the rule of the Ghazanavids. Death of the Umayyad Caliph Abdul Rahman III in Spain; accession of Hakam. Death of the Ikhshid ruler Ungur accession of Abul Hasan Ali.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Qarmatian ruler Abu Mansur; accession of Hasan Azam. Assassination of the Ikhshid ruler Abul Hasan Ali; power captured by Malik Kafur.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Buwayhid Sultan Muiz ud Daula, accession of Bakhtiar. Death of the Hamdanid ruler Sail ud Daula.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Byzantines occupy Aleppo. Death of the Ikhshid ruler Malik Kafur; accession of Abul Fawaris.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: The Fatimids conquer Egypt.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Buluggin b Ziri founds the rule of the Zirids Algeria.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Shia Sunni disturbances in Baghdad; power captured in Baghdad by the Turkish General Subuktgin.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Abdication of the Abbasid Caliph AI Muttih; accession of At Taii.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Turk General Subuktgin. Death of the Fatimid Caliph Al Muizz.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: The Buwayhid Sultan Izz ud Daula recaptures power with the help of his cousin Azud ud Daula. Death of the Samanid ruler Mansur, accession of Nuh II. In Spain death of the Umayyad Caliph Hakam, accession of Hisham II.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Buwayhid Sultan Izz ud Daula, power captured by Azud ud Daula. The Hamdanids overthrown by the Buwayhids.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Subkutgin becomes the Amir of Ghazni.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: End of the Qarmatian rule at Bahrain.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the- Buwayhid Sultan Azud ud Daula; accession of Samsara ud Daula.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Zirid ruler Buluggin, accession of Mansur.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: The Buwyhid Sultan Samsara ud Daula overthrown by Sharaf ud Daula.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Buwayhid Sultan Sharaf ud Daula, accession of Baha ud Daula.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Deposition of the Abbasid Caliph At Taii, accession of AI Qadir.

title: 10th Century (900-999) C.E.
text: Death of the Zirid ruler Mansur, accession of Nasir ud Daula Badis.

text: Battle of AI Uqab in Spain, end of the AI Mohad rule in Spain. The AI Mohads suffer defeat by the Christians in Spain at the Al-Uqba. The AI Mohad Sultan An Nasir escapes to Morocco where he dies soon after. Accession of his son Yusuf who takes over title of AI Mustansir.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: In North Africa death of the AI Mohad ruler Al Nasir, accession of Al Mustansir. The Banu Marin under their leader Abdul Haq occupy the north eastern part of Morocco.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: The Banu Marin under their leader Abdul Haq occupy north eastern part of Morocco. The AI Mohads suffer defeat by the Marinids at the battle of Nakur. The Banu Marin defeat the AI Mobads at the battle of Nakur.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: The Marinids suffer defeat in the battle fought on the banks of the Sibu river. Abdul Haq is killed and the Marinids evacuate Morocco. In the battle of Sibu the Marinids suffer defeat; their leader Abdul Haq is killed and they evacuate Morocco.

text: Death of the Ayyubid ruler AI Adil, accession of AI Kamil. The Marinids return to Morocco under their leader Othman and occupy Fez.

In Spain a brother of Yusuf declares his independence and assumes the title of AI Adil. In Spain Abu Muhammad overthrows AI Adil. AI Adil escapes to Morocco and overthrows Abdul Wahid.

AI Mamun invades Morocco with Christian help. Yahya is defeated and power is captured by Al Mamun. He denies the Mahdiship of Ibn Tumarat.

text: Death of the AI Mohad ruler Abdul Walid II, accession of

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.

text: Death of the AI Mohad ruler Abul Hasan, accession of Omar Murtaza. Abu Said attacks Tlemsen, but is ambushed and killed; accession of his son Murtada.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: The Marinids return to Morocco, and occupy a greatar part thereof.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: The Mongols sack Baghdad. Death of the Abbasid Caliph Mustasim. End of the Abbasid rule. Fall of Baghdad, end of the Abbasid caliphate. The Mongol II-Khans under Halaku establish their rule in Iran and Iraq with the capital at Maragah. Berek Khan the Muslim chief of the Golden Horde protests against the treatment meted out to the Abbasid Caliph and withdraw his Contingent from Baghdad.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Abu Abdullah the Hafsid ruler declares himself as the Caliph and assumes the name of AI Mustamir.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Battle of Ayn Jalut in Syria. The Mongols are defeated by the Mamluks of Egypt, and the spell of the invincibility of the Mongols is broken. Baybars becomes the Mamluk Sultan.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Bahauddin Zikriya in Multan who is credited with the introduction of the Suhrawardi Sufi order in the IndoPakistan sub-continent.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Halaku. Death of Fariduddin Ganj Shakkar the Chishti saint of the Indo-Pakistan sub-continent.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Berek Khan the first ruler of the Golden Horde to be converted to Islam. The eighth crusade. The crusaders invade Tunisia. Failure of the crusade.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Malik ul Salih establishes the first Muslim state of Samudra Pasai in Indonesia. Murtada seeks the help of the Christians, and the Spaniards invade Morocco. The Marinids drive away the Spaniards from Morocco. Assassination of Murtada; accession of Abu Dabbas.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Abu Dabbas is overthrown by the Marinida, End of the Al Mohads. End of the rule of the AI Mohads in Morocco, the Marinids come to power in Morocco under Abu Yaqub.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Mansa Wali the founder of the Muslim rule in M ali.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Muhammad I the founder of the state of Granada. Yaghmurason invades Morocco but meets a reverse at the battle

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Jalaluddin Rumi.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Nasiruddin Tusi. The Marinids wrest Sijilmasa from the Zayenids. Ninth crusade under Edward I of England. The crusade ends in fiasco and Edward returns to England.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Baybars.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Battle of Hims.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Yaghmurasan. Accession of his son Othman.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Tunisis splits in Tunis and Bougie.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Death of Ghiasuddin Balban. Death of Abu Yusuf Yaqub. Bughra Khan declares his independence in Bengal under the name of Nasiruddin.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: End of the slave dynasty Jalaluddin Khilji comes into power. Othman embarks on a career of conquest and by 1290 C.E. most of the Central Maghreb is conquered by the Zayanids.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Saadi.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Alauddin Ghazan converted to Islam.

title: 13th Century (1200-1299) C.E.
text: Mongols invade Syria. The Marinids besiege Tlemsen the capital of the Zayanids.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Bengal, Death of Ruknuddin the king of Bengal, succeeded by brother Shamsuddin Firuz.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Granada, Death of Muhammad II; succession of Muhammad III.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Death of Ghazan, succession of his brother Khudabanda Ul Jaytu. In Algeria, Death of Othman, succession of his son Abu Zayan Muhammad.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Khiljis empire, Alauddin Khilji conquers Rajputana.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Death of Dava, succession of his son Kunjuk.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Assassination of the Marinid Sultan Abu Yaqub Yusuf; accession of Abu Thabit

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Deposition of Kunjuk, power captured by Taliku. In Algeria, Death of Abu Zayan Muhammad, succession of his brother Abu Hamuw Musa. In the Marinids empire, Abu Thabit overthrown by Abu Rabeah Sulaiman.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Assassination of Taliku, accession of Kubak. In Granada, Muhammad III overthrown by his uncle Abul Juyush Nasr.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Kubak overthrown by his brother Isan Buga. In the Marinids empire, Abu Rabeah Sulaiman overthrown by Abu Said Othman. In the Khiljis empire, Alauddin conquers Deccan.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Tunisia, In Tunis Abul Baqa is overthrown by Al Lihiani.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Invasion of Syria, the Mongols repulsed. In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Toktu, accession of his nephew Uzbeg.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Kashmir, Rainchan an adventurer from Baltistan overthrows Sinha Deva the Raja of Kashmir. Rainchan is converted to Islam and adopts the name of Sadrud Din. In Granada, Abul Juyush overthrown by his nephew Abul Wahid Ismail.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Tunisia, War between Bougie and Tunis, Lihani defeated and killed. Abu Bakr becomes the ruler of Bougie and Tunis.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Death of Khudabanda Ul Jaytu, succession of Abu Said. In the Khiljis empire, Death of Alauddin, accession of Shahabuddin Umar, usurpation of power by Malik Kafur, a Hindu convert.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Khiljis empire, Assassination of Malik Kafur, deposition of Shahabuddin Umar, accession of Qutbuddin Mubarak. In the Chughills empire, Isan Buga overthrown by Kubak.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Khiljis empire, Assassination of Qutbuddin Mubarak, usurpation of power by Khusro Khan a Hindu convert. Khusro Khan overthrown by Ghazi Malik. End of the rule of Khiljis. In Tunisia, Abu Bakr expelled from Tunis by Abu Imran. In the Tughluqs empire, Ghazi Malik founds the rule of the Tughluq dynasty.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Death of Kubak, succession of Hebbishsi who is overthrown by Dava Temur.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Dava Temur overthrown by Tarmashirin, who is converted to Islam. In Bengal, Death of Shamsuddin Firuz. The kingdom divided into two parts. Ghiasuddin Bahadur became the ruler of East Bengal with the capital at Sonargaon, Shahabuddin became the ruler of West Bengal with the capital at Lakhnauti.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Bengal, Shahabuddin dies and is succeeded by his brother Nasiruddin.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Tughluqs empire, Death of Ghazi Malik (Ghiasuddin Tughluq); accession of his son Muhammad Tughluq. In Granada, Assassination of Abul Wahid Ismail, succession of his son Muhammad IV. Assassination of Muhammad IV. Accession of his brother Abul Hallaj Yusuf. In the Samudra Pasai empire, Death of Malik al Tahir I, accession of Malik al Tahir II. In Bengal, With the help of Ghiasuddin Tughluq, Nasiruddin over-throws. Ghiasuddin Bahadur and himself become's the ruler of United Bengal.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Death of Othman, succession of Orkhan. Orkhan conquers Bursa and makes it his capital.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, The Turks capture the city of Nicaea.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Tughluqs empire, Muhammad Tughluq shifts the capital from Delhi to Daulatabad in Deccan.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Death of Tramashirin, succession of Changshahi. Amir Hussain establishes the rule of the Jalayar dynasty at Baghdad. In Tunisia, Abu Bakr overthrows Abu Imran and the state is again united, under him. In Bengal, Muhammad b Tughluq reverses the policy of his father and restores Ghiasuddin Bahadur to the throne of Sonargeon.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Death of Abu Said Othman, sucession of Abul Hasan. In Bengal, Annexation of Bengal by the Tughluqs.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Death of Abu Said, power captured by Arpa Koun. In the Chughills empire, Assassination of Changshahi, accession of Burun.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Arpa defeated and killed, succeeded by Musa. Birth of Amir Temur. In the Jalayar empire, Death of Amir Hussain, succession of Hasan Buzurg. In the Ottoman Turks empire, The Turks annex the state of Karasi. In Bengal, The Tughluq Governor at Sonargeon assassinated by armour bearer who captured power and declared his independence assuming the name of Fakhruddin Mubarak Shah.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, The rule of Musa overthrown, Muhammad becomes the Sultan. In the Sarbadaran empire, On the disintegration of the II-Khan rule, Abdur Razaq a military adventurer establishes an independent principality in Khurasan with the capital at Sabzwar. In the Muzaffarids empire, On the disintegration of the II Khan rule Mubarazud Din Muhammad established the rule of the Muzaffarid dynasty. In the Ottoman Turks empire, The Turks capture the city of Nicomedia. In Algeria, Algeria is occupied by Marinids.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Muhammad overthrown, succession of Sati Beg. Sati Beg marries Sulaiman who becomes the co-ruler.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Kashmir, Death of Sadrud Din, throne captured by a Hindu Udyana Deva. In the Chughills empire, Deposition of Burun, accession of Isun Temur. In Bengal, The Tughluq Governor at Lakhnauti-Qadr Khan assassinated and power is captured by the army commander-in-chief who declares his independence and assumes the title of Alauddin Ali Shah.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Muzaffarids empire, The Muzaffarids conquer Kirman. In the Chughills empire, Deposition of Isun Temur, accession of Muhammad.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Uzbeg, succession of his son Tini Beg.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Tini Beg overthrown by his brother Jani Beg.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Muhammad overthrown, power captured by Kazan. In Bengal, Ilyas an officer of Alauddin murders his patron and captures the throne of West Bengal.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Mongols II Khans empire, Deposition of Sulaiman, succession of Anusherwan.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Samudra Pasai empire, Death of Malik al Tahir II, accession of Tahir III. His rule lasted throughout the fourteenth century. In Bengal, llyas captures East Bengal and under him Bengal is again united. He establishes his capital at Gaur.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Chughills empire, Deposition of Kazan, accession of Hayan Kuli. In Tunisia, Death of Abu Bakr, succession of his son Fadal. In Kashmir, Death of Udyana Deva, throne captured by Shah Mirza who assumed the name of Shah Mir, and rounded the rule of Shah Mir dynasty.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: The Marinids capture Tunisia. In the Bahmanids empire, Hasan Gangu declares his independence and establishes a state in Deccan with the capital at Gulbarga.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Kashmir, Death of Shah Mir, accession of his son Jamsbed. In Algeria, The Zayanids under Abu Said Othman recapture Algeria.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Sarbadaran empire, Revolt against Abdur Razaq. Power captured by Amir Masud. In Tunisia, Deposition of Fadal, succession of his brother Abu Ishaq. In Kashmir, Jamshed overthrown by his step brother Alauddin Ali Sher.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Death of Abul Hasan, succession of Abu Inan. In the Tughluqs empire, Death of Muhammad Tughluq accession of Firuz Shah Tughluq.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Algeria, The Marinids again capture Algeria. Abu Said Othman is taken captive and killed.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: End of the Mongol II Khan rule. In the Ottoman Turks empire, The Turks acquire the fortress of Tympa on the European side of the Hollespoint. In the Muzaffarids empire, The Muzaffarids conquer Shiraz and establish their capital there.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Muzaffarids empire, The Muzaffarids annex Isfahan. In Granada, Assassination of Abu Hallaj Yusuf, succession of his son Muhammad V.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Jalayar empire, Death of Hasan Buzurg, succession of his son Owaia.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Jani Beg, succession of Kulpa.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Bahmanids empire, Death of Hasan Gangu, accession of his son Muhammad Shah. In the Muzaffarids empire, Death of Mubarazuddin Muhammad; accession of Shah Shuja. In the Marinids empire, Assassination of Abu Inan, succession of Abu Bakr Said. In Bengal, Death of Ilyas, succession of his son Sikandar Shah.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Death of Orkhan, succession of Murad. In the Muzaffarids empire, Shah Shuja deposed by his brother Shah Mahmud. In Tunisia, Abul Abbas a nephew of Abu Ishaq revolts and establishes his rule in Bougie. In Algeria, The Zayanids under Abu Hamuw II recapture Algeria. In the Marinids empire, Abu Bakr Said overthrown by Abu Salim Ibrahim. In Granada, Muhammad V loses the throne in palace revolution, succeeded by Ismail.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Muzaffarids empire, Death of Shah Mahmud. Shah Shuja recaptures power. In the Chughills empire, Power captured by Tughluq Temur. In Granada, Ismail overthrown by his brother-in-law Abu Said.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Murad conquers a part of Thrace and establishes his capital at Demolika in Thrace. In the Golden Horde empire, Kulpa overthrown by his brother Nauroz. In the Marinids empire, Abu Salim Ibrahim overthrown by Abu Umar. Abu Umar overthrown by Abu Zayyan.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, State of anarchy. During 20 years as many as 14 rulers came to the throne and made their exit. In Granada, Abu Said overthrown by Muhammad V who comes to rule for the second time. In Kashmir, Death of Alauddin Ali Sher, succeeded by his brother Shahabuddin.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, The Turks defeat the Christians at the battle of Matiza, the Byzantine ruler becomes a vassal of the Turks.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Assassination of Abu Zayyan, succession of Abu Faris Abdul Aziz.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: Power captured by Amir Temur. End of the rule of the Chughills. Amir Temur captures power in Transoxiana. In Tunisia, Death of Abu Ishaq. Succession of his son Abu Baqa Khalid.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Tunisia, Abu Baqa overthrown by Abul Abbas under whom the state is reunited. In the Sarbadaran empire, Death of Amir Masud, succession of Muhammad Temur.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Invasion of Bulgaria, Bulgarian territory upto the Balkans annexed by the Turks.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Death of Abu Faris, succession of Abu Muhammad.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Abu Muhammad overthrown by Abul Abbas.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Sarbadaran empire, Deposition of Muhammad Temur, power captured by Shamsuddin. In the Jalayar empire, Death of Owais, succession by his son Hussain.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Kashmir, Death of Shahabuddin, succeeded by his brother Qutbuddin.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Bahmanids empire, Death of Muhammad Shah, succeeded by his son Mujahid.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Bahmanids empire, Mujahid assassinated, throne captured by his uncle Daud.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the Black Sheep empire, Bairam Khawaja found the independent principality of the Turkomans of the Black Sheep and established his capital at Van in Armenia. In the Bahmanids empire, Assassination of Daud; accession of Muhammad Khan.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Power is captured by Toktamish, a prince of the White Horde of Siberia. In Amir Temur's empire, Amir Temur crosses the Oxus and conquers Khurasan and Herat. Amir Temur invades Persia and subjugates the Muzaffarids and Mazandaran.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Amir Temur's empire, Annexation of Seestan, capture of Qandhar.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Amir Temur's empire, Conquest of Astrabad, Mazandaran, Rayy and Sultaniyah. In the Muzaffarids empire, Death of Shah Shuja, accession of his son Zainul Abdin. In the Marinids empire, Abul Abbas overthrown by Mustansir. Turkomans of the Black Sheep empire, Death of Bairam Khawaja, succession of Qara Muhammad.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Amir Temur's empire, Annexation of Azarbaijan, Georgea overrun. Subjugation of Gilan and Shirvan. Turkomans of the Black Sheep defeated. In the Marinids empire, Death of Mustansir, succession of Muhammad.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Marinids empire, Muhammad overthrown by Abul Abbas who comes to power for the second time.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Algeria, Death of Abu Hamuw II, succession of Abu Tashfin. In the Tughluqs empire, Death of Firuz Shah Tughluq, succeeded by his grandson Ghiasuddin Tughluq II.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Muzaffarids empire, Death of the poet Hafiz Shirazi. In the Tughluqs empire, Death of Ghiasuddin Tughluq II, accession:\tof Abu Bakr Tughluq Shah. Turkomans of the Black Sheep empire, Death of Qara Muhammad. succession of Qara Yusuf.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Tughluqs empire, Abu Bakr overthrow by Nasiruddin Tughluq. In Bengal, Death of Sikandar Shah, accession of his son Ghiasud. In the Burji Mamluks empire, The rule of the Burji Mamluks rounded by Saifuddin Barquq.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In Amir Temur's empire, Annexation of Fars. In the Muzaffarids empire, Annexation of the Muzaffarids by Amir Temur. In Granada, Death of Muhammad V, succession of his son Abu Hallaj Yusuf II.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Jalayar empire, Death of Hussain, succession of his son Ahmad. In Granada, Death of Abu Hallaj ; succession of Muhammad VI.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: Amir Temur defeats Tiktomish, the ruler of the Golden Horde. Capture of the Jalayar dominions by Amir Temur. In the Marinids empire, Death of Abul Abbas; succession of Abu Faris II.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: Amir Temur defeats the Duke of Moscow. In the Tughluqs empire, Death of Nasiruddin Tugluq, accession of Alauddin Sikandar Shah. In Kashmir, Death of Qutbuddin. Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Qara Othman established the rule of the White Sheep Turkomans in Diyarbekr.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Amir Temur defeated Toktamish and razes Serai to the ground. End of the rule of the Golden Horde. Annexation of Iraq by Amir Temur. In the Tughluqs empire, Death of Sikandar Shah. Accession of Muhammad Shah.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Amir Temur's empire, Destruction of Sarai, and of the rule of the Golden Horde. In the Sarbadaran empire, Principality annexed by Amir Temur.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Bahmanids empire, Death of Muhammad Khan.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Amir Temur's empire, Campaign in India. In the Marinids empire, Death of Abu Faris II. In the Tughluqs empire, Invasion of Amir Timur, Mahmud Shah escapes from the capital. In Morocco, Death of the Marinid Sultan Abu Faris II; succession of his son Abu Said Othman.

title: 14th Century (1300-1399) C.E.
text: In the Amir Temur's empire, Campaign in Iraq and Syria. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Saifuddin Barquq, succession of his son Nasiruddin in Faraj.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Burji Mamluks empire, The Mamluks lost Syria which was occupied by Amir Timur.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Timur Qutluq, the ruler, installed by Amir Timur. accession of Shadi Beg.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Defeat of Bayazid at the battle of Ankara, taken captive Amir Timur.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Muhammad I, the son of Bayazid ascended the throne.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Timurids empire, Death of Amir Timur, succession of his son Shah Rukh.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Deposition of Shadi Beg, installation of Faulad Khan by the king maker Edigu.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Deposition of Faulad Khan, installation of Timur.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Deposition of Timur, installation of Jalaluddin. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Nasiruddin Faraj, succession of Al Muayyad.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Deposition of Jalaluddin, installation of Karim Bardo.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Deposition of Karim Bardo, installation of Kubak Khan.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Deposition of Kubak Khan, installation of Jahar Balrawi. Deposition of Jahar Balrawi, installation of Chaighray.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Edigu, overthrow of Chaighray, power captured by Ulugh Muhammad.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Ulugh Muhammad overthrown by Daulat Bairawi. 1420:\tTurkomans of the Black Sheep empire, Death of Qara Yusuf; succession of his son Qara Iskandar. In Morocco, Assassination of Abu Said Othman; succession of his infant son Abdul Haq.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Death of Muhammad I; accession of his son Murad II. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Al Muayyad, succession of Muzaffar Ahmad. Muzaffar Ahmad overthrown by Amir Saifuddin Tata, Death of Saifuddin Tata, succession of his son Muhammad. Muhammad overthrown by Amir Barsbay.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Daulat Bairawi, succession of Berk. In Algeria, The Halsida of Tunisia occupy Algeria. This state of affairs continued throughout the fifteenth century.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Uzbegs empire, Abul Khayr, a prince of the house of Uzbeg declare his independence in the western part of Siberia,

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Berk overthrown by Ulugh Muhammad who captured power for the second time.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Uzbegs empire, Abul Khayr occupies Khawarazm.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the Black Sheep empire, Deposition of Qara Iskandar; installation of his brother Jahan Shah. Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Death of Qara Othman, succession of his son Ali Beg. In Tunisia, Death of Abul Faris after a rule of forty years, succession of his son Abu Abdullah Muhammad.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In Tunisia, Deposition of Abu Abdullah Muhammad, power captured by Abu Umar Othman.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Barsbay, accession of his minor son Jamaluddin Yusuf; Yusuf overthrown and power captured by the Chief Minister Saifuddin Gakmuk. Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Ali Beg overthrown by his brother Hamza.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Ulugh Muhammad withdrew from Sarai and found the principality of Qazan. Said Ahmad came to power in Sarai.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Hamza overthrown by Jahangir a son of Ali Beg.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Crimea seceded from Sarai.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Timurids empire, Death of Shah Rukh, succession of Ulugh Beg. In the Ottoman Turks empire, Second battle of Kossova resulting in the victory of the Turks. Serbia annexed to Turkey and Bosnia became its vassal.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Astra Khan seceded from Sarai.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Uzbegs empire, Abul Khayr captures Farghana. In the Timurids empire, Death of Ulugh Beg, succession of Abdul Latif.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Timurids empire, Assassination of Abdul Latif, accession of Abu Said.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Death of Murad II; accession of his son Muhammad II.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Capture of Constantinople by the Turks. Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Death of Jahangir; accession of his son Uzun Hasan. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Gakmuk. succession of his son Fakhruddin Othman. Othman overthrown by the Mamluk General Saifuddin Inal.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Attack against Wallachia, Wallachia became a vassal state of Turkey.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Annexation of Serbia.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Annexation of Bosnia and Herzogovina. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Saifuddin Inal, succession of his son Shahabuddin Ahmad. Shahabuddin Ahmad overthrown by the Mamluk General Saifuddin Khushqadam.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Annexation of Albania.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Said Ahmad, succession of his son Khan Ahmad. In Morocco, Assassination of Abdul Haq. End of the Marinid rule. Power snatched by Sharif Muhammad al Jati.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the Black Sheep empire, Death of Jahan Shah, end of the rule of the Black Sheep Turkoman rule. Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Jahan Shah of the Black Sheep attacked the White Sheep. Jahan Shah was defeated and the Black Sheep territories annexed by the White Sheep. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Death of Khushqadam, accession of his son Saifuddin Yel Bey. Deposition of Yel Bey, power captured by the Mamluk General Temur Bugha.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Uzbegs empire, Death of Abul Khayr, succession of his son Haidar Sultan. Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Uzun Hasan defeated the Timurids at the battle of Qarabagh whereby the White Sheep became the masters of Persia and Khurasan. In the Burji Mamluks empire, Deposition of Femur Bugha, power captured by the Mamluk General Qait Bay.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Timurids empire, Death of Abu Said, disintegration of the Timurid state. In Khurasan Hussain Baygara came to power and he ruled during the remaining years of the fifteenth century.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In Morocco, Sharif Muhammad al Jati overthrown by the Wattisid chief Muhammad al Shaikh who establishes the rule of the Wattisid dynasty.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, War against Persia; Persians defeated.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Ottoman Turks empire, Annexation of Crimea. War against Venice. Tukey became the master of the Aegean Sea.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Death of Uzun Hasan, succession of his son Khalil.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Khalil overthrown by his uncle Yaqub.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Assassination of Khan Ahmad, succession of his son Said Ahmad II.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Golden Horde empire, Said Ahmad I1 overthrown by his brother Murtada. In the Ottoman Turks empire, Death of Muhammad II, accession of Bayazid II.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Uzbegs empire, Death of Haider Sultan, succession of his nephew Shaybani Khan. In Tunisia, Death of Abu Umar Othman after a rule of 52 years, succession of Abu Zikriya Yahya.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In Tunisia, Abu Zikriya Yahya overthrown by Abul Mumin.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In Tunisia, Abul Mumin overthrown, power recaptured by Abu Yahya.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Death of Yaqub. accession of his son Bayangir.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Bayangir overthown by his cousin Rustam.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Burji Mamluks empire, Abdication of Qait Bay, succession of his son Nasir Muhammad.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, Rustam overthrown by Ahmad. Anarchy and fragmentation.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Burji Mamluks empire, Deposition of Nasir Muhammad, power captured by Zahir Kanauh.

title: 15th Century (1400-1499) C.E.
text: In the Uzbegs empire, Shayhani Khan conquered Transoxiana. In the Golden Horde empire, Death of Murtada, succession of Said Ahmad III." In the Ottoman Turks empire, The Turks defeated the Venetian fleet in the battle of Lepanto.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: In the Burji Mamluks empire, Zahir Kanauh overthrown by Ashraf Gan Balat.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Isamil I establishes the Safavid dynasty in Persia, and the Twelve-Imam Shi'ism becomes the state religion.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The Portuguese under d'Albuquerque establish strongholds in the Persian Gulf.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Turkomans of the White Sheep empire, End of the White Sheep dynasty and the annexation of their territories by the Safawids.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: D'Albuquerque conquers Malacca from the Muslims.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The Ottoman Sultan Selim Yavuz ("the Grim") defeats the Mamluks and conquers Egypt.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The reign of Sulayman the Magnificent begins.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Louis of Hungary dies at the Battle of Mohacs.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The Battle of Panipat in India, and the Moghul conquest; Babur makes his capital at Delhi and Agra.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The Ottomans take Buda in Hungary.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Unsuccessful Ottoman siege of Vienna.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The architect Sinan builds the Suleymaniye mosque in Istanbul.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The rise of the Muslim kingdom of Atjeh in Sumatra.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Islam spreads to Java, the Moluccas, and Borneo.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The death of Sulayman the Magnificent.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Alpujarra uprising of the Moriscos (Muslims forcibly converted to Catholicism) in Spain.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The Ottomans are defeated at the naval Battle of Lepanto, and their dominance in the Mediterranean is brought to a close.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: The Battle of the Three Kings at Qasr al-Kabir in Morocco. King Sebastian of Portugal is killed.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Reign of Safavid Sultan Shah Abbas I begins.

title: 16th Century (1500-1599) C.E.
text: Mustaili Ismailis split into Sulaymanis and Daudis.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Sind annexed by the Mughals. End of the Arghun rule in Sind.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Khandesh annexed by the Mughals.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Battle of Urmiyah. Turks suffer defeat. Persia occupies Tabriz, Mesopotamia. Mosul and Diyarbekr. Death of Muhammad III, Sultan of Turkey, accession of Ahmad I. In Morocco al Shaikh died.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: In Indonesia death of Alauddin Rayat Shah, Sultan of Acheh, accession of Ali Rayat Shah III.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Death of the Mughal emperor Akbar; accession of Jahangir.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Annexation of Ahmadnagar by the Mughals.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Annexation of Bidar by the Mughals

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Kuch Behar subjugated by the Mughals.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.
text: Kamrup annexed by the Mughals.

title: 17th Century (1600-1699) C.E.

text: Imam Musa Sadr is apparently assassinated after he disappears on a trip to Libya. He was the religious leader of the Lebanese Twelve-Imam Shi'ites. He promoted the resurgence of Shi'ites in Lebanon and set the foundation of Amal.

title: 20th Century (1900-1992) C.E.
text: The Shah leaves Iran on January 15, thus bringing the Pahlavi dynasty to an end.

title: 20th Century (1900-1992) C.E.
text: On 1 Muharram AH 1400/21 November, the first day of the 15th Islamic century, fanatics led by students of the Theological University of Medina attempt to promote one of their group as Mahdi and thus fulfill a certain prophetic Hadith: "A man of the people of Medina will go forth, fleeing to Mecca, and certain of the people of Mecca will come to him and will lead him forth against his will and swear fealty to him between the rukn (Black Stone corner of the Kabah) and the Maqam Ibrahim." They hold the Haram of Mecca against the army for two weeks. Sixty-three of the 300 fanatics are captured alive, the mosque is recovered, and the conspirators are all put to death.

title: 20th Century (1900-1992) C.E.
text: Beginning of the Iran-Iraq war.

title: 20th Century (1900-1992) C.E.
text: Iran-Iraq comes to an end with much loss of life.

title: 20th Century (1900-1992) C.E.
text: Military annexation of Kuwait by Iraq, under Ba'athist leader Saddam Hussain, is reversed in 1991 by a coalition of United States-led forces.
